title: Check out some Summoner’s Rift concept art!

replies.body: I like the new map but I really wish we could see more of a difference in the quadrants

Thank you very much for the feedback!  We actually tried really different quadrants.  The problem we ran into is that when quadrants are drastically more different, it becomes really tricky to blend them so the midlane wouldn't look funny with each side belonging to a completely different climate/atmosphere.  We tried "fading out" from the center of each quadrant, but the map simply isn't large enough for the gradual blending we'd like to co-exist with maintaining a consistency within the quadrant.  Hope my bad description is making sense :)  Thanks again for the comment!

The concepts are usually done before we make 3d in game models. Sometimes we make an awesome mind blowing concept, but it does not work in the game. Examples:  The design is hard to click on. Or it does not fit the environment, Or it does not look like tanky enough? or look weak enough? The creatures have to look, in relation to each other, at the correct power level or defensive power level. An environment piece has to be cool but not distracting to champions or effects. All the concept work here is about trying to answer those questions. Does it work with gameplay? Does it fit the big picture? Art serves gameplay. 

I hope this answers your question.  GG

If you guys ever make changes to the jungle in that the jungle camps scale after spawning (like drake and Barron), then you could have "weaker" looking monster camps (e.g. sprites) at the start, then they eventually get replaced with "stronger" looking camps (e.g. Razorbeaks) as the game progresses, maybe with subtle changes in their attack styles or how the buffs work from Smiting the camps. Maybe this would make the jungle feel more alive than just a stasis where things spawn waiting to be killed; it can be a place where monsters kill or be killed and where only the strongest survive. Of course, the current state of the jungle might delay any fruition of this plan, but it's just a thought.

At one point during this concept we had at least 5 ashes copy and pasted on this concept. The reason for that was to help with scale. When we paint details next to a champ it helps with figuring how big to make things. How big should a pebble be? how big should a brick be? or a tree? or a grass blade? that sense of scale has always been a challenge since SR and dominion, We are getting better at it.  :)

Has there ever been a consideration for evolving terrain? Something that can be attacked or felled to block a path or simply grow-over some pre-existing route as time goes by, tightening it, or even fluctuating and gradually changing small pieces of the map? Maybe not a lot of it but a few things here and there would add a lot of depth to team-fight decisions regarding terrain, jungling, and escaping.

I've been wondering this for a while and was hoping for some clarification; are the two factions on Summoner's Rift meant to represent the Protectorate (South) and the Magelords (North) mentioned in Aatrox's lore? In any case, I LOVE this concept art, I hope to see more like this in the future!

The basic story about the rift is as follows: The league of Legends a assembled to settle wars in an arena as opposed to in the outside world. Some champions joined the league willingly, and some were abducted(mainly void-related champs) for the good of runeterra. You can see plenty of factions and groups as you read more lore, but the red and blue teams on the rift are totally separate.

Right, but I meant in the differing styles for the two sides' motifs and minions. The North Side (Red) looks very mystical, even sporting owls and using more Magicky-looking minions, whereas the South Side (Blue) features a more typical stout knight-like look, including a stag motif. Even picture 15 in this concept art references these various looks, naming them as Paladins and Mages. These names very much sound like they could be alt names for Protectorate and Magelords. I'd like to know if the two SR sides are meant as little stand-ins for these lore groups. Possibly not, but I think it has the potential!
